listBibl.head: Selected bibliography:
listBibl.bibl: Finch, Chauncey E. "Three Textual Notes," Illinois Classical Studies 3 (1978): 269-272 esp. 269-272
Laistner, M. L. W., and H. H. King. A Hand-List of Bede Manuscripts. Itaca: Cornell university press, 1943.
Mostert, Marco. The Library of Fleury. A Provisional List of Manuscripts. Hilversum: Verloren, 1989.
Viré, Ghislaine. ‘La transmission du De astronomia d’Hygin jusqu’au XIIIe siècle’. Revue d’histoire des textes 11 (1981): 159–276.
Viré, Ghislaine. ‘Le Texte Du “De Astronomia” d’Hygin: Question de Méthode’. Latomus 51 (1992): 843–56.

msItem.incipit: Est domus in terris set uiuit sempe in undis
msItem.bibl: Chauncey E. Finch, "Three Textual Notes," Illinois Classical Studies 3 (1978) 269-272.

msItem.incipit: Est enniracio qualiter terminus paschalis inueniri possit. martius habet relulares XXXVI aprilis XXXV si uis inuenire terminum in martium

msItem.rubric: Incipit compotum grecorum anni circuli qualiter calculare debeas
msItem.incipit: Ianuarius augustus et december IIII Nonas habent
msItem.explicit: Si uis inuenire quota feria sir ipse terminus pachalis
msItem.bibl: Borst, Der karolingische Reichskalender und seine Überlieferung bis ins 12. Jahrhundert. Teil 1, pp. 403.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De natura rerum (ch. 14-17)
msItem.incipit: Sunt autem sui cuique planetarum circuli quos greci hapsides in stellis uocant
msItem.explicit: Signa XII uel a causis annalibus uel a gentilium fabulis nomina sumpserunt

msItem.note: Addition to Bede's DNR on the names of the zodiacal signs

msItem.title: De sideribus
msItem.author: Ps. Priscianus
msItem.note: Added probably in the 11th century with musical neums.

msItem.rubric: In dei nomine incipiunt pauca de ratione conputandi secundum solem et lunam me legat annales uult qui cognoscere ciclos tempora qui uaria qui simul astra poli
msItem.incipit: Sciendum nobis quo modo sol in principalibus linguis uocatur

supportDesc.collation: Quire marks in roman numerlas on the last verso of quires on fols. 8v (I), 16v (II), 24v (IIII), 32v (V), 40v (VI), 48v (VII), 54v (VIII), 62v (VIIII), 70v (X), 78v (XI), 86v (XII), 94v (XIII), 102v (XIIII), 110v and 118v probably cut out with the lower margin (XV? and XVI?), 124v (XVII);

history.origin: Viré (1981) suggested that the manuscript was written in Northern France, possibly in Auxerre (following a suggestion by B. Bischoff). Laistner and Beeson considered it a product of Fleury.

msItem.author: Aethicus Ister
msItem.title: Cosmographia
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Aethici philosophico editus oraculo a Hieronimo presbitero translatus in latinum ex cosmografia mundi scriptura edicta aethici philosophi cosmographi

msItem.note: Four glossaries of Greek and Latin medical terms.
msItem.incipit: De decem specibus medicamentorum; haec sunt de animalibus terennis

supportDesc.collation: The text of Aethicus' Cosmographia is in five regular quaternios (125-132, 133-140, 141-148, 149-156, 157-164), seuing strings visible in the middle of quires, with two surviving quire marks at the bottom of the last verso in capital letters: f. 132v (A) and f. 164v (E). The Hermeneumata take one quaternio (ff. 165-172) and one ternio (ff. 173-178).
